Test Name: B-cell Lymphoblastic Leukemia Minimal Residual Disease Detection by Flow Cytometry
Specimen Type: Bone marrow aspirate (preferred) or peripheral blood
Purpose: To detect minimal residual disease in patients with B-cell lymphoblastic leukemia, providing information on disease status and treatment efficacy.
Container: Heparinized vacutainer (dark green top) or EDTA tube
Equipment: Flow cytometer (e.g., BD FACSCanto II, Beckman Coulter CytoFLEX)
